thread.title: 14 Dating Struggles Of Being The "Late" One
thread.title_full: 14 Dating Struggles Of Being The "Late" One

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: 14 Dating Struggles Of Being The "Late" One
text:
1. Your date will get frustrated as hell the first few times they meet up with you.
I apologize for being late, there was traffic and I left way after i told you.
‚Äî erikacurry (@gillygal) October 3, 2015 Sure, the first time you're 15 minutes late, they just chill and reread the menu. The next few times, they begrudgingly order (and finish) a beer by the time you sprint in with your expected "OMG, so sorry, hope you didn't wait too long!" fare.
2. If you end up dating long-term, your S.O. will start calling you out on it ~all the time~.
http://fivesostext.tumblr.com/post/154371359899/ive-forgotten-what-you-look-like-luke4-hey Not that you don't completely deserve it, but ugh, do they even know you?
3. Your partner will learn to do their own math when meeting up with you.
Just tell me when and where and I'll be there 20 minutes late
‚Äî expreslve üéÉ (@EXPRESlVE) July 2, 2016 This may or may not involve some white lies about the movie starting at 7:15 when it's an 8 p.m. show time.
4. After a while, your S.O. will start trying to be late, aka on your time.
You won't be mad at me for being late if you stop thinking I'm gonna be on time. pic.twitter.com/SerRoBO10B
‚Äî Jamilah Lemieux (@JamilahLemieux) January 31, 2017 Except they will still get there earlier than you somehow. So they'll just go back to being early/on actual time and scrolling through Twitter while they wait for your untimely ass.
 5. Leaving together = them inevitably waiting impatiently as you finish your makeup.
5 mins. More üò¨ #alwayslate
A post shared by Ross‚úø (@__rossross__) on Feb 12, 2017 at 2:53pm PST
They see you're dressed and packed up, so they foolishly assume you're ready to go. Except LOL, silly boy, I have makeup to do.
6. You have absolutely messed up a brunch reservation.
üôÑüòêüòî
A post shared by 'Vince (@suckmykicks) on Dec 26, 2016 at 12:44pm PST
 Having to wait an extra hour isn't enough to change your ways though.
7. You always end up with the crane-your-neck, front-front-row seats at the movies.
http://ifunnny.tumblr.com/post/156996919646 Congrats , you've crushed their dream of snuggling in the much more private and ~romantic~ back row.
8. You make your partner especially nervous when you have to do something big, like fly together.
 sorry i'm late, i have terrible time management skills and zero perception of distance as it pertains to speed of travel
‚Äî Ali Garfinkel (@aligarchy) May 16, 2015 Knowing you and your ways, they miiiight overdo the timing a little. You'll both end up at the airport four hours before your flight and spend a fortune on overpriced cocktails at TGI Friday's.
9. If your phone dies, it is a minor catastrophe.
NOBODY !!! I got your Back Susan ! üòä
A post shared by @1foxybitch on Feb 13, 2017 at 3:16pm PST
The digital era enables us to be our worst selves by texting our S.O.s updates like, "5 more min!" and, "2 more min!" and, "jk, 10 more min!" BUT IF YOUR PHONE DIES (which, thanks to that Apple update , it 100 percent will), let's be real: You have no idea what your boyfriend's phone number actually is or the exact spot you agreed to meet, so that's another 20 to 40 minutes of waiting!
10. Whenever you're earlier than they expected, your partner is extra into you.*
 http://sassdwarf.tumblr.com/post/144222296173/when-youre-running-late-like *To be clear, you are still late, but objectively early for your usual late time, so you get a really affectionate cheek kiss out of it!
11. You make an effort to be better, except you end up getting places way too early and go back to your tardy ways.
http://graubedruckt.tumblr.com/post/86387162001 What are you supposed to do for the extra 10 minutes? Be alone with your thoughts ? No.
12. You definitely wonder why your time management skills are so off.
Truth! I used to always be on time. Enter children--always late! ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
A post shared by Wylie Brown (@wyliepbrown) on Feb 1, 2017 at 10:12am PST
Especially when you know it drives the naturally punctual person you love, a bit crazy.
13. But luckily, your bae embraces your lateness, especially when they see you're kind of working on it.
When you've officially run out of excuses: pic.twitter.com/eavBmNiGCf
‚Äî Not Will Ferrell (@itsWillyFerrell) March 23, 2015 14. Because you are who you are, which is literally always 10-plus minutes late.
They say good things take time, that's why I'm always late #wednesdaywisdom
‚Äî ‚òÖMs.Kiyiekah‚ô§ (@RawkinsLizzie) November 30, 2016 Follow Julia on Twitter .
